name: Rosen Inn International

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel on 2 separate occasions. My husband and I stayed in April 2006 and my husband, myself, and our youngest teen daughter stayed in July 2006. Our chihuahua was with us both times.
reviews.title: Very good value

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and Value for the money

reviews.text: This hotel is an excellent value for the person who comes to Orlando for Disney and Universal, and just needs somewhere to sleep and wind down after long days at the parks. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The pool areas are nice and a good place to relax. The hotel is close to everything on International drive and many things are within walking distance. The staff in the lobby are all extremely pleasant and very helpful.
reviews.title: I want to go back!

reviews.text: My only complaint about this hotel is the breakfast. From what I can recall, it's around 10 bucks a person and it is horrible! Even for a good breakfast buffet that is expensive.... but if it was good, I at least would not complain. I complain simply because it really and truly is awful. DO NOT waste your money. Go instead to the I-HOP, Denny's, or Golden Corral down the street. As for the Ponderosa places, I don't care for them either as their eggs are powdered and not real, etc. I personally don't care for that.
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know some people complain about the noise at this hotel...and yes, it is true that it is an extremely busy hotel and there are always tons of people staying there. However, I had no problems with noise or with sleeping either time that I stayed.
reviews.title: Basic but good

likes.liked: — Good quality accomodation, very clean, and great value
likes.disliked: — Looking a bit dated, and a bit worn

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel. If at any time you are there and have a problem, I would suggest speaking with the day manager... his name is Albert and he is extremely nice. I have spoken to him on several occasions, but never to complain. But it is because of my conversations with him in the past that I am pretty confident he would be more than willing to solve any problems with a guest.
reviews.title: very clean ,good place to stay,exelent value ,had brill time here

likes.liked: — all you can eat buffets,and clean room
likes.disliked: — gest services trying to get me to veiw time share propetys offering me $100 to take time out of my holiday.

reviews.text: We stayed here for 17 nights 13 - 30 October 06 through a Virgin package. We booked at QI as we were meeting friends there and they had already booked ahead.
reviews.title: The good, the bad and the ugly at the QI - I-Drive!!

likes.disliked: — a dated hotel in need of a refurb - very basic, old fashioned and in need of a facelift!

reviews.text: The hotel was a bit like staying at a Holiday Camp - lots of Brits around, (nothing wrong with that) but it did feel a bit like being housed at Butlins in the 70's but with the tropical climate! I would say it attracted people on a tight budget with a liking for football shirts. Sorry for being snobbish!
reviews.title: You get what you pay for
great value
reviews.text: The good: linens/carpet and furnishings were clean in our room. Provided in the room is a microwave, tea/coffee maker, fridge, TV, iron/board and hairdryer, alarm clock and wireless connection - so the amenities were good. Toiletries and towels were replenished daily. There are 2 pools, (we only used one) and the temperature was very nice - towels and sunbeds aplenty. Pool closed at 10pm so quite early. Onsite there is a bar with entertainment, games room, gift shop and convenience store. So all in all, the QI did provide all the basic amenities. Grounds and planted areas were all nicely kept. Security was good with checks in/out of the hotel and plenty of staff about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad: hotel looked tired and dated. Public areas were brown, dark and dreary. Furnishings and layout very 70's council estate. Stairwells were concrete and gloomy. All rooms are approached by a communial balcony - so your window and door face onto this. If you like everyone to have an open view of you whilst relaxing in your room fine - if not, you will have to draw the curtains for privacy. We saw a few sights I can tell you!! Due to the layout of the open balcony, the noise levels were high as not only did you get passing traffic by your window, but ft was doubled as you also faced onto the open areas/pool/car park or fountain - which obviously were popular places.
reviews.title: Budget Hotel - Chav city

reviews.text: The ugly: The bathroom was tiny and cramped. There was mould on the surrounds and ceiling of our room and an unsavoury bath mat in the tub which was kind of glued down and icky. I did complain and in favour of Virgin/QI they offered a room move, but I declined as we just had too much stuff to pack up. However, they did a thorough bleach job and clean and most of the mould was removed.
reviews.title: VALUE FOR MONEY

reviews.text: me and the family have just got back from our holiday at the quality inn. We had a great time the food was great hotel pool was nice clean and warm staff were brill the weather was in the 80s rooms were nice. There were a couple of problems though. I reported that the dryers wernt working on our block on the second day of our holiday so we had to go to the other block. By the 10th day there was only 2 dryers working in the complex and this complex is very big.If you are planning to go in november check with yourtravel agent about the florida classic. it is about 2 black collages they meet every year for a game of american football and 80 thousand supporters line the street on international drive it is very intimadating. To make it worse they put some supporters in the next room to my family.My daughter was crying with the noise tried to phone security the phone did not work half past five in the morning we got to sleep. reported the carry on in the morning and the staff were great. Would i stop again deffinetly i just would not go on the 18th of november again
reviews.title: spot on but

likes.disliked: — the maids kept leaving the air con

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fantastic value for money hotel. We have stayed here for the last 3 years running, and have just booked again for January. The room is quite basic, but has everything you would need. The fridge comes in very handy. After a full day at a theme park, this hotel is perfect to come back to and sleep. The food in the restaurant is not that nice, but with Dennys right outside, and Cici's pizza just across the street, you will not go hungry. The location is perfect, you can access all the malls by the I ride trolley or the local Lynx bus. The I ride also goes to Seaworld if you miss the hotel bus that takes you to Universal/Seaworld. We would not book another hotel on International Drive!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about booking our stay at the QI after reading a few negative reviews, however, there were postive comments for the accomodation aswell as the poor, and the price we paid was unbeatable, so I thought 'what the heck!' and we booked.
reviews.title: Basic but comfortable, clean and excellent value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Novenber 29 2006 1 Night.
reviews.title: Paid $38 Not worth $3.80

reviews.text: A Special Internet Price of $38, and at that price we were robbed.
reviews.title: Great for budget travellers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fault I should have known better. All night traffic noise from the I4, and from neighbours. Many family parties. Drunken adults roaming the corridors at 3.00am. Room dirty, Bathroom filthy. Just two small hand towels, have seen larger face flannels. No bath towels.
reviews.title: Very Basic but good location

reviews.text: Furniture battered. Door did not fit. Had been recently broken open but did lock.
reviews.title: as usual
Extremely Basic
reviews.text: Outside corridors used as a football pitch by kids. Internet access $10 a night surcharge. Checked in at 10pm or would never have spent the night there. Not recommended.

We stayed for 7 nights at the end of January. The hotel and the rooms were clean, the bathroom was a bit small. Hotel staff is helpful. We had problems with the lock of the door: once we found our door open upon our return from the parks - which of course was a BAD surprise (but nothing was missing.) After complaining, security and maintenance came straight away. Had problems with the hi-speed internet connection and the maintenance guy came straight away to fix it. All in all, a clean, budget hotel conveniently located on I-Drive which may lack a bit in comfort/maintenance, but makes up for it with a good staff service. NB: in low season( not sure about high season) there's only one shuttle pick-up for SeaWorld (three for Universal) in the morning.
reviews.title: Clean budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked this hotel directly with the Rosen hotel Group who own the Quality Inn's for a week long stay in Jan 2007.
reviews.title: Good value for the money

likes.disliked: — stairwells and balconies to enter rooms

reviews.text: Upon arriving at the hotel we we greeted by friendly staff who were well informed and helpful. We proceeded to the room they had given us in the main building. Getting to the room is a bit like I would imagine to a second floor council flat. That in its self is not a bad thing but it depends on what you are used too thats all.
reviews.title: What a relief

likes.disliked: — the 1 bug found in the room

reviews.title: won't be back
reviews.text: The room was good for space but some of the corners of the room could have done with a good hoover.

reviews.title: Great hotel and Location
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is brilliant and makes up fully for the lack of a top quality room.

reviews.title: Whats the problem?
reviews.text: We arrived from Sanford Airport down Interstate 4. It took us about one hour, due to quite heavy Friday afternoon traffic in the Orlando area. I admit to being a bit anxious after reading the negative feedback regarding noise, creepy crawlies, surly staff, etc. Check in was pretty painless, within five minutes we were sorted and on our way to Room 1177. This room was the second closest to The International Drive exit to the hotel. The anxiety level was raised a bit by this, being the room everyone had to walk past to gain access to I`Drive. Once in the room, it was clear that the room contents were a bit dated, but clean and everything worked ok. I made a point of looking in all those places, where roaches frequented, but could not find any. The air conditioning was chugging away, and made the room feel lovely and cool away from the sweltering temperature outside. " Us Brits aint used to this heat ! " After a freshen up, we ventured out onto International Drive. There is a pedestrian crossing straight outside. Any person from the UK who has not been to Florida before would be well advised to use them, as the road is very busy, and the locals have a low tolerance threshold to jaywalking. There is also a bus stop number 22, bang outside. This is a great service the I Ride trolley will take you anywhere on I Drive for $1. We never used the hotel ammenities, other than the shop, so could not comment. The shop was fine, and had everything you would reasonably need. The first night was quite noisy, being a Friday. This was mainly down to young males who feel the need to cruise up and down I Drive, in vehicles with bass lines to that would make the Space shuttle lose a few tiles. After a while tiredness kicked in and we managed to sleep ok. The hectic schedule of the attractions during the following days ensured a good nights sleep was almost guaranteed. The security guy on the car park was always vigilant, we forgot to display our parking permit the second day, and he advised us to display it or you dont get in. This was reassuring. All in all, when you do the Orlando holiday thing, you are on the go all day, and you just need to rest your head in a place that is clean and safe. For the money, it is good value, if a little dated. But if you want The Waldorf Astoria you will have to pay Waldorf Astoria prices. So " Whats the problem" The Quality Inn is a nice place to have a nice holiday at a nice price.

reviews.title: Basic but fine
reviews.text: Basic but fine. Rooms were clean, location great for parks. Breakfast good as kids eat free with adults - $7 eat as much as you want bacon, sausage, eggs, pancakes, fruit, cereal. 2 pools that aren't too busy as lots of people are out at parks and you use towels at poolside then put in bin to wash. Washers and dryers freely available $1.25, change machine in lobby. Free internet access wireless in lobby or $9.95 per day in room, use lobby if u got wireless. Ice machines on every other floor so use fridge in room for nightcaps. Nothing wrong with this hotel as you are only changing and sleeping in room if you are in orlando.

reviews.title: Great hotel, friendly and clean!!
reviews.text: Returned from 2week stay at end of july and have to say after reading all the reviews befor i went was a little nervous of what to expect! To anybody who's worried.. Don't be! This place is great!

Its got evreything you need. Great location (5mins to universal and wet n wild) The air-con in the rooms is really good, infact too cold at times! The room itself is fairly spacious with a fridge and a microwave and cleaned evreyday by the maid. Got a small shop in the hotel selling a good varitey of snacks and drinks. Also there is a english style pub near the lobby!
reviews.title: Brill Hotel

reviews.text: The resturant's food isnt great and is quite pricey for what you could find down i-drive where there are hunderds of resturants.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel in an Excellent Position

likes.disliked: — Hotel was dated/tired looking ........needs a face lift!

reviews.title: Full review. Nice Place to Stay.
reviews.text: First and foremost, this is a hotel for families. Our stay in mid-September, 2006 confirmed you get very good value, very good budget accommodation, and very good service, and a good location on the very tourist friendly International Drive. Even with our reservation pre-booked through Expedia at US$55. per night for two nights, all taxes and fees included, the check-in was fast, five minutes at most. The staff was pleasant and efficient, and had answers to all of our questions.

The rooms are all set in two six floor high towers and several low rise buildings. In a separate building are housed the lobby, restaurant, bar, convenience store for small grocery items and the like, and a couple of small stores, with the usual Disney merchandise for sale. The pool is located in the central landscaped courtyard. All rooms are accessed by outside corridors only, which I prefer as you have no interior noise echoing down corridors outside your room and you have sunlight and fresh air aplenty.
reviews.title: it is what it is!

reviews.text: All floors are serviced by elevators and stairs and there are open air coin-operated laundry facilities, vending machines, or ice machines located at every floor. Parking is free, and the lots are well maintained, with landscaping and security booths manning the two entrances 24 hours a day.
reviews.title: A typical budget class motel
Trailer Park
reviews.text: The all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet runs from 6:30 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. and offers cereal (raison bran/frosted corn flakes), pancakes, hash brown potatoes, beans in tomato sauce, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs in shell, sausage, bacon, toast, bagels, buns, rolls, fresh fruit (bananas, cantelope, oranges), jello, and other assorted items, tea and coffee. We ate late, arriving after 10:00 a.m., and observed no shortage of food or fresh hot servings right up until 10:30 a.m. Breakfast does not include beverages (juices, milk, etc.) which cost extra. Milk for cereal is available at no additional charge. Cost is US$8.00 per person, children under 12 each free when accompanied by a paying adult. (There are all-you-can-eat breakfast buffets elsewhere (go north on International Drive), for US$4.00 per person serving until 11:30 a.m.)

The rooms are large (12 feet by 22 feet) and look and smell fresh. The rooms have an in wall air-con/heating unit with digital temperature setting so you can turn the unit to on/off/auto temp control. The unit fans are very quiet and efficient. There are several spare electrical outlets available for you to plug in all your electronic gear. The rooms are well equipped with iron, ironing board, hairdryer, mutli-setting microwave with turntable, mini-fridge (no freezer unit), coffee maker with coffee, four plastic drinking glasses, four styrofoam drinking cups, multi-channel cable television with remote, digital clock radio (with alarm), telephone with free local calling, high speed internet connection for laptops, TV internet with keyboard (check with hotel at booking if this service is continuing), in room metal wall safe with key lock, metal door with security lock (not security chain) and peephole and electronic key card (not key) access, light blocking window drapes, table, two chairs, desk with chair, bureau with four large drawers, 2 mirrors, two double beds with firm mattresses and endtable between beds and individual night reading lights, and foam pillows.
reviews.title: Great Hotel.

reviews.text: Just returned from a two week stay in America, the first week staying at the Quality Inn. The location was excellent, convenient for Disney theme parks and shopping on I Drive, The room we had was pleasant clean and furnishings good, we were on the ground floor overlooking the pool. Towards the end of the week we had breakfast at the hotel which was pay for an adult and child under 11 eats free, this worked out much cheaper than eating out on I drive, the breakfast was excellent and you could, if you wished eat as much as you liked.The hotel had a bus service to the disney theme parks at $14 dollars return, it picked up at several other hotels, we made the mistake of thinking that it went to all the Disney theme parks but depending on the mood of the day it would terminate at one or two of the theme parks, leaving you to make your way on the free Disney shuttle buses to your chosen destination.
reviews.title: A Good Base

reviews.text: I would certainly stay at the Quality Inn again, it must have had a revamp from reading the old reviews, one person did mention seeing the arrival of new furniture, its clean, convenient to all amenities, very well priced and very good value for money.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there in August 2006. We had 2 adults and 2 teenagers in one room and two adults in another. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were cleaned daily. New towels were left as well. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. You could have a good breakfast in the dining area that would keep you going for the day. Our rooms were on the sixth floor. Lifts were always available. Don't buy anything from the souvenier shop in the hotel area as you will find the same thing on International drive for half the price. It is very central to everything on international Drive. The pool was clean and heated and was open until ten o'clock at night. There were free daily trips set up for Universal Studios, but Disney trips were expensive. Making your own way to Disney parks works out a lot cheaper. You can be picked up by un-official Disney buses and works out to be around $2 per person. They usually stop at bus stops to ask if anyone is heading to a Disney park. It is worth going with them as they are more frequent than normal buses. Overall, the hotel is very good and we enjoyed our stay there. We would go again!
reviews.title: Very basic. Stay if you only concern is somewhere to sleep

likes.liked: — The location of this hotel is great.
likes.disliked: — People walking past the appartment in the early hours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on May 03.
reviews.title: Basic, could do with more decoration
Very Basic
reviews.text: The staff were very helpfull, check in was painless. The resturant was nice, clean and inviting with good food.

aka: Quality Inn International Drive Hotel Orlando
